## This room will be closed and archived.
** @/all Please move discussion of this topic to our forum, or to one of the official Free Code Camp chat rooms: http://forum.freecodecamp.com/t/free-code-camp-official-chat-rooms/19390**

Anybody monitoring this can ignore the following. I’m just testing (again) my grasp of quoting inline code in a chat message.

```
var hello = “world”;
```
Haha I was a little confused.
i couldn’t remember how to format code, so i practiced here, before fumbling around in an active room
i was just messing around

Sorry I'm not sure what exactly this means. I think your using a variable named test to call 1. And a variable named code to call "goes here".  I have a only about 1 month experience in Ruby and absolutely none in JavaScript.

Another test
```
var code = “goes_here”;
```
Comment after the code

```
var test = 1;
```
this is a test
Sounds good. I would suggest joining the FB group for Temecula.  I haven’t seen anyone else active in this chat room lately.  Probably why they’ve recommended using FB for local campsite activity.

I don't have any specific plans yet. I'm just getting started on fcc but I think getting together regularly with a group of people would obviously make it a little easier. If you set anything up I'm definitely available. I am available all day Monday's, Tuesday's and available in the evenings any other day.
I’ll probably just start having irregular announcements at a particular coffee house and see if people show up.  otherwise, I’m certainly open to input.
not yet. I put it out there on FB if anyone has a suggested venue. There about 12 people in the group so far.
Do you have any groups meet up ever?
Cool.
We’re also on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/groups/free.code.camp.temecula/
Hi @randytorres. I’m almost done with my Basic Algorithm Scripting bonfires.  I took about a month and a half off being busy, so I’m redoing my bonfires.
Hello, anybody going through the course right now? how far are you?

##Please note that we now recommend campers use their Campsite’s Facebook group for chatting instead of their campsite’s Gitter chatroom. 
We are doing this because few of our Campsite Gitter chatroooms have active synchronous discussions, and about 1/3rd of conversations consist of someone saying “hello” and not getting a response. Most of the discussions are asynchronous, which Facebook posts and group messages are better suited for.
We’ve removed this Gitter room from our Campsite directory. Still, we will keep it open for archival purposes, and you can keep using it if you’d like.
Here’s a short blog post about how our Campsites are evolving and growing: http://blog.freecodecamp.com/2015/09/jump-start-your-local-campsite-with-coffee-and-code.html

That’s “meetup” not “metope.”  I think auto correct tried to “help” me.  Although, I don’t know what “metope” means.

If anybody else that has joined the Temecula group stops by here, let us know!  Say hello so we know you’re on Gitter.  Plus we’re looking for input for a coffee metope soon.  Cheers on this awesome rainy day!

I’m new.  I started learning Java & C++ on my own (plus a little PHP to handle Wordpress).  Then I came across FCC about a month ago.  I’ve been coding every day since.  I want to learn Full Stack Javascript to add to my skill set.  What really cinched the deal for me was the opportunity to help non-profits with real-world coding.  It’s win-win.
I'm new- took some CS courses 10 years ago in undergrad but since then nothing.  Just started FCC yesterday.
are you a beginner or are you experienced dev?
yeah i dont mind where we go
If we can get some of the other group members to chime in too, we can go from there.  We can always try one place and change it for the next time too.
I’m open if you have any ideas on a location
usually crowded
oh yeah that one is nice
Would like to get one going soon.  Maybe Starbucks?  The location on Winchester & 15fwy (on the mall/east side) is big!
any meetups planned for the future?
Exciting!  Campsite chat rooms are here.  Thanks guys
